title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 526.10 - Inpatient nasogastric feeding procedures
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 526.10 - Inpatient nasogastric feeding procedures

State Regulations
(a) General. Nasogastric tubes may be used for feeding purposes in
inpatient facilities when determined to be clinically appropriate, following
consideration of all possible routes and types of nutrition
administration. (b) Conditions for use. (1)

The use
of nasogastric feeding tubes shall be ordered by a physician. (2)

In selecting the size and type of
nasogastric feeding tubes to be employed, staff shall make every effort to
minimize patient discomfort. (3)

Unless otherwise ordered and clinically justified by a physician, the size of a
nasogastric feeding tube used on an individual patient shall not exceed: (i) 6 French if the patient's body weight is
less 50 pounds; (ii)
8 French if
the patient's body weight is 50 pounds or more, but less than 100
pounds; (iii)
12 French if the
patient's body weight is 100 pounds or more. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 14

526.10

Amended, New

York State Register, Volume XXXVI, Issue 22, effective
6/4/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
